intro: Heterotheca villosa var. camporum, commonly known as the Camps Hollow goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often used in native plant gardens due to its adaptability and ornamental value.
